fields.description:
Apparently if one creates a lot of issue security levels then viewing issues becomes very slow as there are a lot of database calls.

Need to try creating a lot of levels and seeing if we can improve things, for exmaple using caching.

The security levels can be created via Jelly.
fields.summary: Investigate using JIRA with a lot of issue security levels

fields.description: After adding a value to a secondary list in a cascading select list field, JIRA redirects one to the primary list page.  It should probably stay on the secondary list page, to provide feedback of success (list item has been added) and let the user enter more options.
fields.summary: UI problem: redirected to parent page when adding cascading select list options

fields.description: JIRA needs a quip list, similar to what bugzilla has.
fields.summary: Quip list

fields.description:
Attempting to sort by issue links field bombs out

This is because the issue links field doesn't have a default sorter I believe

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?sorter/field=issuelinks&sorter/order=$field.defaultSortOrder
fields.summary: Attempting to sort by issue links field bombs out

fields.description: Document changes to Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Document changes to Issue Navigator

fields.description: Edit a filter that has been saved with a particular search order. Reverse that order. Save the filter. You end up with something like: "Sorted by: Key ascending, then Key descending" (See screenshot)
fields.summary: Nonsensical sort orders on saved filters

fields.description:
When resolving an issue, In version 3.03, the default 'assign to' was the reporter. In version 3.23 it is not. Now it looks like it's the current assignee/user, which doesn't make any sense. Even though the reporter's name is under "Automatic", that is not the default.
On a related note, Is there a way of improving the default value in the dropdown value for 'Assign to' when resolving an issue? I need to have users deliberately choose a value when resolving issues or else they go astray. If the dropdown was blank, it would force them to visit the field.
fields.summary: default assign to is wrong

fields.description:
I have the default  Character Encoding  as UTF-8, but this renders ‘smart quotes’ as question marks. I tried changing it to UTF-16 but then JIRA would not display anything except question marks or blanks. I had to go into the database and update the properties table and restart JIRA to get it up and running again.
According to this link:
http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;232580
Microsoft doesn't support UTF-8
According to this link:
http://www.microsoft.com/globaldev/DrIntl/columns/021/default.mspx#Q3
UTF-16 is the appropriate substitute, which is also supported by JIRA, according to this link from your documentation:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/intl/encoding.doc.html 

So, how do I configure my application properly for MS SQL Server?
fields.summary: Inserting curly, smart quotes are not handled correctly

fields.description:
If you sort by priority, and then by priority again, you see them sorted twice (see sort description).

It looks like the 'equals' method on SearchSort may include the direction perhaps.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator sorts by the same column in different directions

fields.description:
I need to find all issues that are fixed in a certain timeframe. I tried to achieve this with the "Due After" and "Due Before" fields, but without any luck (no issues were found).
What I need is a way to search for issues that were set to a certain workflow state in a certain timeframe (e.g. "fixed between 01/01/05 and 02/01/05" or "closed between 01/01/05 and 02/01/05")
fields.summary: Find issues by fixed date

fields.description: By hardcoding the right parameters (including os_username and os_password), one can create a HTML form which submits to JIRA, creating issues.  This could be useful in scenarios where one doesn't wish to expose the full JIRA UI to users.  We should document how to do this.
fields.summary: Document how to create alternative issue creation interfaces in JIRA

fields.description: All fields selected are in the scope of the custom field. When you select multiple issues of the same type, say Improvement, then the custom field shows up in the bulk edit. If I select multiple issues of a different type, say Bug, again the custom field shows up in the bulk edit. But, if I select one of the Improvement issues selected before and one of the Bug issues selected before, the custom field does NOT show up in the bulk edit. It would seem you must only select issues of the same type in order for the custom field show up in the bulk edit. If you select issues of different types the custom field does not show up in bulk edit even if both issue types are in the scope of field.

fields.description: As a result of the enhancement to allow for issue navigator searches by multiple projects, when such a search is performed, JIRA decides to abandon what it thinks the user's current project is (since they've selected multiple). While this is a reasonable approach, I ask you to consider another option. You could just not 'blank out' the current project when this is done. Users are so used to having a 'current project' that I think it would be preferable to leave the current project unchanged unless a new single project has been chosen. While I see the logic in blanking it out from a programmatic standpoint, I don't see the advantage from a usability perspective.
fields.summary: multiple project searching loses 'current project'

Since the package same is the same, you can just go with the classname

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7426].
  {panel}

It is very important for my group to be able to Print nicely formatted listings of bugs. It is vital that I am able to print out just the right detail of information for product planning purposes. Here are my problems:

1. I am unable to create multiple saved column customizations. For instance, when printing I often want more detail displayed than when I'm simply reviewing the bugs online. Also, some meetings require certain columns, such as reporter, while others don't. I want to be able to easily switch between configurations of displayed columns.

2. It's often difficult to display enough information about a issue on a single row of output. This is especially true when printing. My ideal preference is to be able to display two or three rows of data per issue. This is detailed enough to be useful, but small enough to have the issue list be useful as a summary (printing a full page per issue is way too much paper to get a high level overview).

3. An alternative to #2 would be landscape mode printing, instead of portrait mode. Even if I set my browser to use landscape mode, the page has already been unescessarily limited when viewing the "Printable" format. This alternative, while perhaps easier for you guys to implement, would not be as useful to me as #2.

3. Formatting for "Printable" should be better. First, there is already too much wasted space. The header consists of about 20% of the first page, and is almost entirely useless. A simple concise summary of the filter used should be provided, and would only take of 1% of the page. Additionally, PDF output should be supported. I love PDF output in Confluence, why doesn't JIRA have it?
fields.summary: Improved IssueNavigator Display, Print and Column Customization

fields.description:
Often I find myself wanting to create a filter that displays some arbitrary set of issues. This is particularly useful in conjunction with confluence. To give you an example, if I wanted to display on the wiki a set of issues that will be reviewed as a meeting. 

To facilitate this, I would simply like to be able to type into the quick search "JIRA-104 JIRA-49 JIRA-287" and have it return a list of those three bugs. Additionally, I would find it useful to do the same thing on Bugzilla ID.

As an alternative solution, but in my opinion not nescessarily a better solution in all cases, a custom field can be created, such as a keywords field. This field could be populated with specific keywords that can be used to perform the search, such as "keyword: meeting-102".
fields.summary: Need to be able to define searches for a specific set of issues

   -> phase description

fields.description:
The portlet "Assigned to me" has the following description: "Shows the issues assigned to the current user."

This is misleading.  This portlet only shows open issues assigned to me, not all issues assigned to me.  for example, issues with a status of "resolved " are not shown.

This causes a problem because an issue reporter/tester will not know when an issue has been fixed (and is thus in the resolved state) and needs to be verified before being closed.

This might be considered a duplicate of http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2443, but the "solution" in 2443 was lame.

The request for this bug is to either (1) change the text of the portlet so it is clear that only open items are shown, or (preferably) (2) modify the portlet so that all issues assigned to me are displayed.

(I am using Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.2.2-#90)
fields.summary: "Assigned to me" Portlet misleading

fields.description:
Currently you are doing a after/before date-range search as *two* separate RangeQueries (the intersection of the two).

This really hammers lucene. The memory utilisation goes through the roof and takes ages to complete - e.g. 2000ms to complete instead of 70ms.

This  particularly hits the Saved Filters hard - as they now display the number of hits.
If you have several filters with date-ranges, then you have a multiplier effect on the performance impact.

To fix this, you will need to treat both elements of a date range as a single search term - and pass a single range query term to Lucene.

I will attach sample code to illustrate the problem:

Here is the log file from jira (displayin the dashboard)
You can see from the amount of GC activity that there are 3 very expensive queries ...

fields.description:
One of our user reported to us that he could not access an issue since he added an attachment to it. I checked and indeed there is no way to access the issue (nothing particular in the server's log).

The name of the file is '13062_% dans le nom.png' without the quotes.

I stopped Tomcat, removed the file and restarted it and we are now able to see the issue.
fields.summary: Attachment with % in name blocks access to the issue

fields.description:
I am trying to extract the issues "closed" in the last week or so.  The only filter I can use is the preset filter "Recently Resolved" which actually pulls out all issues "recently updated". 

My problem is that I have been working on refining my workflow for this project so each time I made a modification I noticed an update to the issue that reads like;

Field Original Value New Value 
issue.field.workflow  ASM [ 13566 ]  jira [ 14337 ]  

This messes up my filter by including in my results issues that were closed in the past week due to this workflow updated but were not necessarily closed or updated in the last week other than the workflow comment that was added.

Is there a solution or a workaround to my problem?
fields.summary: Preset Filter - "Resolved Recently"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7404].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Updated 21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Danke Schoen,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}


*Updated Description*
As a -founder- admin, I want to be able to;
* see all the users that are subscribed to a filer.
* manage which users are subscribed to a filter.
* delete filters even if I am not the filter creator.
fields.summary: Shared Filter Management - subscriptions

fields.description:
I have trackbacks turned on (I was hopping to use it with confluence but no luck there), We posted an issue on our jira which does not have anonymous access, that had a link to another site that happens to use trackbacks. Even though we dont allow anonymous access a portion of the issue report showed up on their site:

http://stlq.info/archives/002009.html

Scroll down and you will see [KWS-933] and above that some of the text from the issue.
fields.summary: Trackback sending "secured" text to another site

fields.description:
Hi

Previously we had several notification schemes that sent out an email to an internal mail group on issue creation.

This allowed people without JIRA admin to configure who got the emails and saved having to create new users who in effect were just for emails, some of our notification schemes do just use groups.

However since upgrading to 3.2.2 + 3.2.3 the email is now longer issued.

Someone has already raised this as JSP-2144, but I'm unable to get to the call.

It was suggested that the email could not be sent because the email address needed to have browse permission to the project ( I'm quoting second hand so this wrong ) if the email is to be sent.

I have noticed that on the notifications page, for single email address it states
"Notifications will be sent only for public issues"

Does this mean that the functionality has changed between 3.2.1 and 3.2.2 ?

please could you tell me if this is a bug or a change in functionality and if so how to get around it ?

thanks

Huw Jones
fields.summary: Single email address notification doesn't work

fields.description:
We have a cascading select custom field that won't show in the issue navigator.


On the issue navigator page, if I click on the "Configure your issue navigator" and add the custom field, I immediately can see the new column with the relevant values, however as soon as I go back to normal mode the column disappears.

It's still there with the correct values showing for each issue if I go back to configure.

Other custom fields seem to work ok

Field is defined as
Issue type(s): Enhancement
and is project specific, i.e. not global

If I look at a particular issue in this project, I can see the custom field value.

This was working in 3.2.1, but you've added screens since then.

thanks

Huw Jones
fields.summary: Custom field type, Cascading Select doesn't show in Issue navigator

fields.description:
I was able to reproduce this on your support site as well. I have two filters.
Click on one of the filters (<filter1>) and it displays the issues for that filter.
Then click on Manage filters (either link) and "Edit Column Order" for a DIFFERENT filter (<filter2>).  It brings you to the correct page, with the phrase " The table below shows issue fields in order of appearance in Issue Navigator for filter "<filter2 name>. 
But when you click on the Issue Navigator link, it actually reverts back to the old filter. One would expect that if you are editing the column order, and next want to edit the filter sort as well, that one would click as described. One may not notice that it actually reverted back to a different filter.
fields.summary: editing a filter's column order is broken

fields.description:
Currently the format of the subject line is:
[JIRA] (JRA-12314) The summary of the issue

For readibility reasons, we manually change the source code and drop the wrapping parenthases. Eg:
[JIRA] JRA-12314 The summary of the issue

For many of our staff, and our external clients, this minor changes makes it easier for them to scan large volumes of email. 
Can we either integrate this change, or make the subject line customizable (Currently you can set the prefix, what if instead you could set the whole subject format. eg: "[JIRA] %KEY% %Subject%"?)  As you can imagine, it is somewhat annoying to have to constantly modify the source and recompile after every upgrade.
fields.summary: Email subject formatting

fields.description:
The name of the priority field 'trivial' seems to be inadequate. When talking about priority this has nothing to do with the complexity of the issue. Therefore trivial is not a good name for this field. 
For example bugs can be highly non-trivial to be fixed, but nevertheless their priority (the profit of solving) can be very low. 

Maybe it should be called "very low "
fields.summary: Priority name "trivial" is not adequate

Australia

Mobile: +61 438 456 947

Hartono Adji/CLTD/COH  21/07/2005 04:04 PM	
To Victor Rodrigues/CLTD/COH@COH_NOTES
cc
Subject security level

Hi Victor,

I tried to search in JIRA for Test Observation issue. I found that 'Find Issue' facility in JIRA does not have this filter. The Custom Fields only display Severity its bottom options.

It would be good if we can have this custom fields, but it is up to you whether it will require too much work or not to provide this custom field.

Thanks,
Hartono
fields.summary: Custom Fields filter request for Security Level parameter

fields.description:
FROM BEN:

When signing up to create a new JIRA account, the username box includes a note about ASCII characters but nothing about the fact that the username must be in lowercase. Only after you have submitted a username with a capital letter do you receive a note that the username must be in lower case which is rather annoying.

Adding a note is the suggested solution to transforming the username in all areas to lower case before it is sent to the JIRA system in order to retain increased transparency to the user that JIRA requires lowercase usernames. I am still concerned that we may need to look at removing cap sensititity from these fields sometime in the future. ?
fields.summary: JIRA username box needs to include a note that the username must be in lower case - on JIRA sign up page

fields.description:
I would like to know how the backup service runs and what causes it to create a zip file. Currently it has a folder and zip file format setup with a 720min cycle time. I have looked at the data that is in the backup folder and it's not clear how the schedual works or what causes the back to run. 

Can I please get some more information on how this works.

Thanks
Dustin Baker
fields.summary: How to configure the Jire backup service

fields.summary: Bug in ViewWorkFlowSteps.jspa?workflow=jira

fields.description:
When hovering over menu items they are not highlighted in IE 6 SP2.

There is no problems in Mozilla Firefox.

I don't think this issue was there in 3.0 Preview.
fields.summary: Menu Items not highlighted

fields.description:
Is it possible for me to have condition to be met prior to allowing an issue to be closed?

This is what I need to do, I need a bunch of fields to be populated prior to being closed.  The field may not be populated when created but MUST be populated when it is closed.
fields.summary: Conditions to be met prior to "Closing" an issue
Create new operations
Hitting the Enter while focussed on a select list should submit the form

fields.description: One gets this harmless error after editing entityengine.xml with certain text editors like UltraEdit, which prepend Byte Order Mark (BOM) bytes to the XML.  Apparently Electric XML doesn't understand these.  This does not affect the operation of JIRA otherwise.
fields.summary: Error on System Info page reading entityengine.xml: java.io.IOException: expected '=', got 'v' line 1, char 8: ...<?xml v

fields.description: YB Chen once again provided a translation pack.  It covers 3.2.3 but we should include it in 3.3 (unless he provides another one closer to the time)
fields.summary: Update Traditional Chinese language pack

fields.description: The field update screen does not display the security level field correctly during the bulk move operation.
fields.summary: Bulk Move - not possible to set issue security level during field update.

fields.description:
During Bulk Move, it is possible to select the smae target issue type and project as the issue/s currently are associated with.

Completing such an operation actually does nothing - so further checking should be implemented to remove current project and issue type selection if possible (e.g. all issues are moving from same project and issue type).
fields.summary: Bulk Move - allows the current issue type and project to be selected as the target issue type and project.

fields.description:
During bulk move, errors can be displayed multiple times on the field update screen.

For example, if the target project does not contain any components but components are made required in the associated field layout - the field update screen will display an appropriate error for each issue that is to be moved.
fields.summary: Bulk Move - errors can be displayed multiple times on field update screen.

fields.description:
If a collection of parent and sub-task issues are selected in the bulk move process, the option to select just the parents or the sub-tasks fails - selecting 0 issues on the first run through the wizard.

On moving to the next step in the wizard, the message that no 'Available Issue Types exist' is displayed.
fields.summary: Bulk Move - selection of parent or sub-task collection fails with no issues selected.
Docs - document the 'Bulk Move' functionality.

fields.description: When doing a Bugzilla import, a new custom field, 'Bugzilla Id' is created, and set to the URL of the old Bugzilla bug corresponding to imported JIRA issues. In JIRA 3.2, this custom field is created but doesn't display anywhere, as it is not enabled in any 'screens'.
fields.summary: Bugzilla and Mantis Id custom fields not enabled on default screen

fields.description:
If logged out, you can still see the attachment fields on the Add Attachment page.
E.g.
(while logged out)
http://support.atlassian.com/secure/AttachFile!default.jspa?id=13640&multiple=true

Attaching fails, but if you then go to log in, a system error is thrown with null user.
fields.summary: Attachment page displays attachments fields even when not logged in.

fields.description:
Hi - I am looking to install a new instance of JIRA. The I.T. department has asked some questions, and I am not that technical. So, how would you answer these questions:
1) If we install as an external database, what would need to be backed up on the application server?
I am assuming that attachments would have to be backed up separately from the database, and that we would then probably not need to use the backup service to create regular XML backups. 
2) I.T. would like to install on a server where ports 80, 8080, 8180, 7001, 8001 are all used. All I found in the forum was a thread that mentioned editing conf/server.xml, but I couldn't find any information on the documentation pages as to how to configure for a different port. 
3) Can JIRA be installed on a Solaris server?
Forgive my lack of technical expertise.
Thanks
fields.summary: Installation information

fields.description:
When attempting to delete a project, or some issues within project, recieve error messages in app interface and atlassian-jira.log.  

This is a pilot project which has been successively built and deleted at least 4 times within the past two weeks -- on this latest attempt, these errors started occuring.  I believe this is the first deletion attempt since the application of a patch provided in resolution for:  http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7319

When trying to delete a project , recieve 

"Form Errors:   * Exception removing project: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.project.ProjectDelete@4e94cc, result: null"

fields.description:
I've encountered a problem when using the "Create Issue Handler" to create new issues from emails.  If an attachment was included an extra notification email is generated about the attachment being "changed" with the updater being reported as "$changelogauthor.fullName".  Here's the beginning of such an email:

=== BEGIN EXAMPLE ===
The following issue has been updated:

    Updater: $changelogauthor.fullName (mailto:)
       Date: Tue, 12 Jul 2005 4:05 PM
    Changes:
             Attachment changed to Empl_002479.pdf
(...email continues...)
=== END EXAMPLE ===

We're just running 2.6.1 professional, so I'm not sure if this affects any other versions.  In my opinion creating an issue from an email with an attachment should only generate one notification email, but if it must generate two then the updater in the "attachment changed" email should be the same as the reporter, not "$changelogauthor.fullName".
fields.summary: Issue creation from email with attachment generates extra notification email

fields.description:
How do I restrict users from reopening issues?

I am currently using Jira's default workflow. All users who can resolve issues can also reopen.

How can I restrict this?  In the permissions I notice that everyone who can resolve can also reopen.

Please help!!
fields.summary: Restricting users from "Reopening" Issues

fields.description:
We have a question that is important to us:


- Can issues in a project be visible by only some groups?

i.e. a project called CMS in which many customers can report their own issues but,
ONLY be able to see their own issues.

Even though there are issues from many other customers in the project.
fields.summary: Configuration of projects (can issues in a project be visible by only some groups?)

Some people like to print the issues that are created in Jira.
